channel.title: R on JY L
channel.description: Recent content in R on JY L

item.title: Using mothur: batch commands for processing sequencing data from Miseq
item.description: Inspired by & based on Mothur Miseq SOP Please try interactive mode before batch mode (to know what happens within each command) Please check numeric parameters within batch file before running it. start from here change the name of the file from stability.files to whatever suits your study make.contigs(file=stability.files, processors=4) summary.seqs(fasta=stability.trim.contigs.fasta) screen.seqs(fasta=stability.trim.contigs.fasta, group=stability.contigs.groups, summary=stability.trim.contigs.summary, maxambig=0, maxlength=275) summary.seqs(fasta=stability.trim.contigs.good.fasta) unique.seqs(fasta=stability.trim.contigs.good.fasta) count.seqs(name=stability.trim.contigs.good.names, group=stability.contigs.good.groups) summary.seqs(count=stability.trim.contigs.good.count_table) ###pcr.seqs(fasta=silva.bacteria.fasta, start=11894, end=25319, keepdots=F, processors=8) rename.

item.title: Commands for microbiota analysis in R
item.description: Inspired by Riffomonas 0. Before you start 0.1 Set working directory setwd(dir = "~/Documents/mothur exercise/rmarkdown/") ~ meaning: root 0.2 Two Sets of Files needed for analysis File origin File type Notes Mothur axes file ended with “.ave.pcoa.axes” tsv(Tab Separated Values)file Mothur summary file ended with “ave-std.summary” convert format into xls, csv, or tsv before importing Mothur summary file ended with “tax.

item.title: Hello R Markdown
item.description: R Markdown This is an R Markdown document. Markdown is a simple formatting syntax for authoring HTML, PDF, and MS Word documents. For more details on using R Markdown see http://rmarkdown.rstudio.com. You can embed an R code chunk like this: summary(cars) ## speed dist ## Min. : 4.0 Min. : 2.00 ## 1st Qu.:12.0 1st Qu.: 26.00 ## Median :15.0 Median : 36.00 ## Mean :15.4 Mean : 42.98 ## 3rd Qu.
